channel.title: Hardware Failure Rates
channel.description:
For those looking into building computers and asking, what parts should I get. Look at this list. The parts are about a year old now and they've definately changed, but I wouldn't be surprised if they were very similar to what they were then.
Summary of the link below: [quote] Parts sold between September '08 and March '09. 6 months to 1 year of operation. Minimum sample of 500, or 100 per model.
[b]Mobo total:[/b] - MSI: 2.46% - Gigabyte : 2.83% - ASRock : 3.11% - ASUSTeK : 3.5%
[b]Mobo P45 Express chipset:[/b] - ASUSTeK 2.69% - Gigabyte 3.81% - ASRock 4.22% - MSI 7.28%
[b]PSU:[/b] - Antec 0.84% - Seasonic 1.31% - CoolerMaster 1.52% - Corsair 1.67% - Fortron 1.70% - Enermax 3.1% - Thermaltake 3.45% - Hiper 4.47%
[b]PSU model (500-550W):[/b] - CoolerMaster 520W RealPower 0.5% - Seasonic M12II-500 0.7% - Antec TruePower Trio 550W 0.8% - Corsair HX520W 1.1% - Seasonic S12II-500 1.1% - Corsair VX550W 1.4% - Antec Earthwatts EA500 1.5% - CoolerMaster Silent Pro M500 1.6% - Fortron Blue Storm 500W 1.6% - Antec NeoPower 500 1.9% - Antec NeoPower 550 1.9% - Thermaltake Toughpower Qfan 500W 1.9% - Enermax Modu82+ EMD525AWT 2.1% - Fortron Blue Storm 2 500W 2.7% - CoolerMaster Extreme Power 500W 2.9% - Hiper HPU-4M530 4.5%
[b]RAM:[/b] - Kingston 0.47% - G.Skill 1.46% - Crucial 1.70% - Corsair 2.19% - OCZ 2.56%
[b]RAM kits >5% failure rate:[/b] - Crucial Ballistix Tracer 2GB DDR2-SDRAM PC8500 BL2KIT12864AL1065 16.3% - OCZ Value 2GB DDR2-SDRAM PC2-6400 OCZ2V8002GK 9.8% - Corsair Dominator 2GB DDR2-SDRAM PC8500 TWIN2X2048-8500C5D 8.5% - Corsair XMS3 DHX 2GB DDR3-SDRAM PC12800 TWIN3X2048-1600C7DHX 8.3% - Crucial Ballistix Tracer 2GB DDR2-SDRAM PC6400 BL2KIT12864AL80A 6.7% - Corsair Dominator 4GB DDR2-SDRAM PC8500 TWIN2X4096-8500C5D 5.9% - Corsair XMS2 DHX 4GB DDR2-SDRAM PC6400 TWIN2X4096-6400C5DHX 5.2% - Corsair XMS3 DHX 2GB DDR3-SDRAM PC12800 TW3X2048-1600C9DHX 5.2% Comparison: Kingston HyperX series 0.84%
[b]GPU:[/b] - PNY 1.69% - ASUSTeK 1.71% - MSI 2.05% - Gigabyte 2.63% - Sapphire 2.7% - Gainward 3.15% - Point Of View 4.67%
[b]GPU chipset:[/b] - NVIDIA GeForce GTX 260: 2.4% - ATI Radeon HD 4850 : 3.3% - NVIDIA GeForce GTX 295 : 6.5% - ATI Radeon HD 4870 : 6.1% - NVIDIA GeForce GTX 280 : 8.3% - ATI Radeon HD 4870 X2 : 10.5%
[b]GPU model:[/b] - Sapphire 4870 X2 10.6% - Gigabyte GV-N98TOC-1GH 10.6% - Sapphire 4870 512MB 10.1% - Gainward GTX 280 8.7% - Gigabyte GV-N98XPZL-1GH 8.1% - Gainward 4870 512MB GS 7.5% - ASUSTeK GTX 280 7.4% - Point Of View 9800 GT 7% - Gainward 4850 512MB GS 6.9% - Gigabyte N28-1GH-B 6.4%
[b]HDD:[/b] - Western 0.89% - Hitachi 0.92% - Samsung 2.25% - Maxtor 2.79% - Seagate 2.89%
[b]HDD models >3% failure rate:[/b] - Samsung SpinPoint T 500GB: 12.9% - Maxtor DiamondMax 22 1TB : 6.5% - Seagate 7200.11 500GB : 5.2% - Maxtor DiamondMax 22 500GB : 4.8% - Maxtor DiamondMax 22 750GB : 3.9% - Seagate 7200.11 1TB : 3.7% - Seagate 7200.11 750GB : 3.6% - Hitachi 320GB IDE : 3.2%
[b]HDD 1TB models:[/b] - Maxtor DiamonMax 22: 6.5% - Seagate 7200.11 : 3.7% - Samsung SpinPoint F1 : 2.9% - Samsung EcoGreen F1 : 1.6% - WD Caviar Green WD10EACS : 0.9% - Hitachi 7K1000.B : 0.8% - WD Caviar Black : 0% - WD Caviar Green WD10EADS : 0% [/quote] It is not a definitive list, but those are just a heads up for what brands to look for and what to avoid.
Source: [url]https://translate.google.com/translate?js=y&prev=_t&hl=en&ie=UTF-8&u=https://www.hardware.fr/articles/773-1/taux-pannes-composants.html&sl=auto&tl=en&history_state0=[/url]

item.title: Hardware Failure Rates
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
Level:

You don’t know much about statistics, do you.

I passed statistics class in high school, if that’s what you mean.

I don’t see how it’s relevant to what I said, because it’s obvious I wasn’t serious.

Anyway, I’m glad I have a WD caviar green, I like an HDD with a 0% failure rate.

Read full topic

item.title: Hardware Failure Rates
item.dc:creator: IsolatedPurity
item.description:
Regardless this is a good resource as long as someone approaches it with follow up research.

Read full topic

item.title: Hardware Failure Rates
item.dc:creator: Level
item.description:
Deutscher Scharfschütze:

i stick a pen through one of my rear fans occasionally to stop the noise it makes, once i pull out, all my troubles go away.

Pulling out solves all problems.

Read full topic

lol

I have an ASUS motherboard, OCZ ram and a Thermaltake powerbox

With those charts my PC should be dead already.

item.title: Hardware Failure Rates
item.dc:creator: Level
item.description:
For those looking into building computers and asking, what parts should I get. Look at this list. The parts are about a year old now and they’ve definately changed, but I wouldn’t be surprised if they were very similar to what they were then.

Summary of the link below:

Parts sold between September '08 and March '09. 6 months to 1 year of operation. Minimum sample of 500, or 100 per model.

Mobo total:

  • MSI: 2.46%
  • Gigabyte : 2.83%
  • ASRock : 3.11%
  • ASUSTeK : 3.5%

Mobo P45 Express chipset:

  • ASUSTeK 2.69%
  • Gigabyte 3.81%
  • ASRock 4.22%
  • MSI 7.28%

PSU:

  • Antec 0.84%
  • Seasonic 1.31%
  • CoolerMaster 1.52%
  • Corsair 1.67%
  • Fortron 1.70%
  • Enermax 3.1%
  • Thermaltake 3.45%
  • Hiper 4.47%

PSU model (500-550W):

  • CoolerMaster 520W RealPower 0.5%
  • Seasonic M12II-500 0.7%
  • Antec TruePower Trio 550W 0.8%
  • Corsair HX520W 1.1%
  • Seasonic S12II-500 1.1%
  • Corsair VX550W 1.4%
  • Antec Earthwatts EA500 1.5%
  • CoolerMaster Silent Pro M500 1.6%
  • Fortron Blue Storm 500W 1.6%
  • Antec NeoPower 500 1.9%
  • Antec NeoPower 550 1.9%
  • Thermaltake Toughpower Qfan 500W 1.9%
  • Enermax Modu82+ EMD525AWT 2.1%
  • Fortron Blue Storm 2 500W 2.7%
  • CoolerMaster Extreme Power 500W 2.9%
  • Hiper HPU-4M530 4.5%

RAM:

  • Kingston 0.47%
  • G.Skill 1.46%
  • Crucial 1.70%
  • Corsair 2.19%
  • OCZ 2.56%

RAM kits >5% failure rate:

  • Crucial Ballistix Tracer 2GB DDR2-SDRAM PC8500 BL2KIT12864AL1065 16.3%
  • OCZ Value 2GB DDR2-SDRAM PC2-6400 OCZ2V8002GK 9.8%
  • Corsair Dominator 2GB DDR2-SDRAM PC8500 TWIN2X2048-8500C5D 8.5%
  • Corsair XMS3 DHX 2GB DDR3-SDRAM PC12800 TWIN3X2048-1600C7DHX 8.3%
  • Crucial Ballistix Tracer 2GB DDR2-SDRAM PC6400 BL2KIT12864AL80A 6.7%
  • Corsair Dominator 4GB DDR2-SDRAM PC8500 TWIN2X4096-8500C5D 5.9%
  • Corsair XMS2 DHX 4GB DDR2-SDRAM PC6400 TWIN2X4096-6400C5DHX 5.2%
  • Corsair XMS3 DHX 2GB DDR3-SDRAM PC12800 TW3X2048-1600C9DHX 5.2%
    Comparison: Kingston HyperX series 0.84%

GPU:

  • PNY 1.69%
  • ASUSTeK 1.71%
  • MSI 2.05%
  • Gigabyte 2.63%
  • Sapphire 2.7%
  • Gainward 3.15%
  • Point Of View 4.67%

GPU chipset:

  • NVIDIA GeForce GTX 260: 2.4%
  • ATI Radeon HD 4850 : 3.3%
  • NVIDIA GeForce GTX 295 : 6.5%
  • ATI Radeon HD 4870 : 6.1%
  • NVIDIA GeForce GTX 280 : 8.3%
  • ATI Radeon HD 4870 X2 : 10.5%

GPU model:

  • Sapphire 4870 X2 10.6%
  • Gigabyte GV-N98TOC-1GH 10.6%
  • Sapphire 4870 512MB 10.1%
  • Gainward GTX 280 8.7%
  • Gigabyte GV-N98XPZL-1GH 8.1%
  • Gainward 4870 512MB GS 7.5%
  • ASUSTeK GTX 280 7.4%
  • Point Of View 9800 GT 7%
  • Gainward 4850 512MB GS 6.9%
  • Gigabyte N28-1GH-B 6.4%

HDD:

  • Western 0.89%
  • Hitachi 0.92%
  • Samsung 2.25%
  • Maxtor 2.79%
  • Seagate 2.89%

HDD models >3% failure rate:

  • Samsung SpinPoint T 500GB: 12.9%
  • Maxtor DiamondMax 22 1TB : 6.5%
  • Seagate 7200.11 500GB : 5.2%
  • Maxtor DiamondMax 22 500GB : 4.8%
  • Maxtor DiamondMax 22 750GB : 3.9%
  • Seagate 7200.11 1TB : 3.7%
  • Seagate 7200.11 750GB : 3.6%
  • Hitachi 320GB IDE : 3.2%

HDD 1TB models:

  • Maxtor DiamonMax 22: 6.5%
  • Seagate 7200.11 : 3.7%
  • Samsung SpinPoint F1 : 2.9%
  • Samsung EcoGreen F1 : 1.6%
  • WD Caviar Green WD10EACS : 0.9%
  • Hitachi 7K1000.B : 0.8%
  • WD Caviar Black : 0%
  • WD Caviar Green WD10EADS : 0%

It is not a definitive list, but those are just a heads up for what brands to look for and what to avoid.

Source:
https://translate.google.com/translate?js=y&prev=_t&hl=en&ie=UTF-8&u=https://www.hardware.fr/articles/773-1/taux-pannes-composants.html&sl=auto&tl=en&history_state0=

Read full topic
